author: _shemnon
content: My current thinking instead of using for kid is (based on comments in this thread) to expose an RPC, both to the engine ports and regular ports, to get the config parameters.  This will consist of a data object with two parts, (a) an object with the full current config and (b) a list of what params will change, and what will be introduced, at the next transition.  It also includes the activation time.

author: _shemnon
content: One question is do we retroactively create a list of historical deltas?

author: _shemnon
content: The update object can then be canonized and we can hash that data and get the “did you do it right” number.  Because of the need for canonization the data object will likely be a json object, as there is an RFC on what a canonical document looks like.
